column3: @MarcoFalke @instagibbs :)
Note that `sendrawtransaction` changed the return code and error string
Sorry @MarcoFalke I confused myself ðŸ˜… , added notes for the changed error codes and strings.
I see that this follows the rule for braces from the coding style putting braces on new lines for methods: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/developer-notes.md#coding-style-c
I noticed that the declaration of `fee` here was moved to a closer scope. As `fee` does not get used outside of the scope this appears to not change behaviour.

Given that the criteria to throw this reject reason appears to be the exceeding of a _feerate_, would it not be more informative to make the `reject-reason` `max-feerate-exceeded` instead of `max-fee-exceeded`? I realize that this would have been a better feedback for #19339, but I only see it now.
Yep, just reducing the scope :)

The never have been? The code happened to be in ATMP, but never executed for network txs.
```suggestion
- The
```
I think this section can be moved to "low level changes" --> RPC section
I guess I was trying to justify the error code change but yeah it's irrelevant here.
Done
Thanks for reviewing :) my "inspiration" was `TransactionError::MAX_FEE_EXCEEDED`, hopefully not too big of a deal
It's a bit of a pet-peeve of mine that *fees* and *feerates* are often mixed up in Bitcoin, but the ship has probably sailed for this change? :thinking:\nI'll have to be faster next time. ;)
Great improvement! :+1:
@Xekyo You're absolutely right that they're often mixed up, but in this context it is actually referring to an absolute fee (by default 0.1 BTC...) rather than a feerate.

Okay, thanks for the clarification. I'm a bit confused by this description then:\n\n>  The `sendrawtransaction` error code for exceeding `maxfeerate` has been changed from  `-26` to `-25`. The error string has been changed from "absurdly-high-fee" to  "Fee exceeds maximum configured by user (e.g. -maxtxfee, maxfeerate)." The  `testmempoolaccept` RPC returns `max-fee-exceeded` rather than `absurd
Oh perhaps it is me who is confusing things.

The [`maxfeerate`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/12a1c3ad1a43634d2a98717e49e3f02c4acea2fe/src/rpc/rawtransaction.cpp#L889) passed into testmempoolaccept is a feerate and the wallet [`-maxtxfee`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/12a1c3ad1a43634d2a98717e49e3f02c4acea2fe/src/wallet/init.cpp#L54) option is a fee amount. I'm not really sure why this is the case ðŸ˜…
I think this should also list the name for these error codes as the number itself is a harder to undertsand.
We can adjust this in the wiki closer to release.
